Procurement of AI Community Model contractual clauses for High-Risk AI

This document, titled ‘Procurement of AI Community Model contractual clauses for High-Risk AI’ (MCC-AI-High-Risk), is a working document produced by the European Commission to assist public administrations in the procurement of Artificial Intelligence (AI) solutions, specifically focusing on ‘High-Risk AI’. It serves as a guide for public buyers navigating the complexities of acquiring AI systems. The document’s primary purpose is to establish a standardized set of contractual clauses designed to ensure consistent and compliant procurement practices. Crucially, it’s explicitly stated as a ‘working document’ and does not represent an official position of the European Commission. Users are solely responsible for its application within public procurement processes. The document’s creation aligns with the broader ‘Procurement of AI’ Community of Practice. It is intended to be used in conjunction with the requirements outlined in the EU’s AI Act. The core of the document centers around defining key terms, notably ‘AI System,’ which is defined as a machine-based system exhibiting varying degrees of autonomy and adaptiveness, capable of generating outputs based on inferred objectives. The document’s creation underscores the European Commission’s commitment to supporting public administrations in responsibly integrating AI technologies. The document’s ongoing development reflects the dynamic nature of AI regulation and procurement best practices. The inclusion of ‘High-Risk AI’ signifies a targeted approach, acknowledging the unique considerations associated with AI systems that pose potential risks to safety, fundamental rights, or other critical areas. The document’s purpose is to provide a framework for managing these risks throughout the procurement lifecycle.
